pages.title: Grants

content.text: Grants usually fund one-off initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.

pages.title: Investments

content.text: A defining hallmark of investment proposals is that the community trades treasury assets for another asset it anticipates to increase in value. Examples can be on-chain (tokens, vesting tokens, NFTs, staked tokens) and off-chain (any traditional world asset). Investments can be purely market-driven or also strategically driven. Strategic decisions can be caused by partner incentive alignment, meta-governance, or M&A.

pages.title: Protocol Changes

content.text: Protocol proposals are used to drive changes in a product controlled by the community, especially on-chain products. These changes can be large or small. For small and low-risk changes, including inflation rate and yield rate adjustments, a lightweight proposal can be used. Additional rigor and communications will be required for high-risk changes such as major product updates. Major changes often are accompanied by audits.
Provide a clear and comprehensive explanation of the change. Include the rationales.
Provide details of the change and implementations
Outline likely risk items and what might go wrong.
Provide the name and info of the auditor, the code that was audited, and the results

content.text: Sometimes a community needs to change its governance, e.g., migrating from  Governor Alpha to Governor Bravo. Typically these meta-governance proposals take the form of contract migrations, but they can also involve the creation of subgroup structures. Additionally, they can involve
off-chain governance structures, such as moving governance forums, adopting off-chain voting methods, etc.
Describe the rationales behind the governance structure change proposed. Include reasons for why now.
challenges that are prompting the change

Expand on the steps required for this change.

A web3 onboarding funnel is a series of steps or stages that help introduce people to the concept of web3 and decentralized finance. Such a funnel would provide people with the necessary knowledge and tools to navigate the world of web3 and decentralized finance safely and effectively while avoiding common pitfalls such as scams and misinformation.
One potential approach to creating a web3 onboarding funnel might involve the following steps:
Start by explaining the basics of web3 and decentralized finance, including key concepts such as blockchain technology, decentralization, and the use of smart contracts.
Next, provide guidance on how to securely store and manage cryptocurrencies, emphasizing the importance of keeping one's private keys safe and never sharing them with others.

Introduce people to the concept of decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), and explain how they can be used to govern and coordinate decentralized networks in a transparent and democratic manner.
Provide resources and information on how to identify and avoid common scams and other forms of fraud in the web3 and decentralized finance space.
Finally, direct people to resources and tools that can help them find and join regenerative DAOs that align with their values and goals.

Overall, the key to creating an effective web3 onboarding funnel is to provide clear, concise, and accessible information that helps people understand the basics of web3 and decentralized finance, while also equipping them with the knowledge and tools they need to navigate this complex and rapidly evolving space safely and confidently.

children.title: Role Definition

content.text: What are the different ways to contribute to your
? Let your members know how they fit in.
DAO Member is a person, organization, multi-signature entity, or any other entity that holds at least one full share of

DAO. As a member, they have full access to the workspace, including the ability to view and comment on every page, create rewards, proposals, and suggestions for editing existing content, as well as unrestricted access to create unlimited pages, sub-pages, texts, and any other form of content they desire.
Team has a simple yet crucial mandate, which is to uphold the DAO Constitution and act in a responsible and ethical manner in the execution of its duties within the
. Their specific roles, obligations, and responsibilities are clearly outlined in the DAO Constitution.

Individuals, Multi-Sigs, or entities that complete any form of onboarding process are granted the role of a Community Member. This may include earning POAPs, participating in Discord chats, engaging on Twitter, earning NFT badges, attending events and receiving event tokens, earning ERC-20 tokens, winning limited edition NFTs, or participating in raffles. Community Members have access to the rewards section, information hub, and the ability to create proposals for DAO Members to review and consider.

children.title: Problem & Solution Deep Dive

content.text: There are several problems that agriculture cooperatives can help solve, including:
Lack of access to financing: Agriculture cooperatives can help farmers access financing by pooling their resources and leveraging their collective bargaining power to secure loans or investments.

High production costs: Cooperatives can help farmers reduce their production costs by sharing resources, such as equipment and facilities, and by negotiating bulk purchasing agreements with suppliers.

Limited market access: Cooperatives can provide farmers with a collective marketing and distribution system, allowing them to access a wider range of customers and fetch better prices for their products.
Poor infrastructure: Cooperatives can help farmers invest in infrastructure
, such as irrigation systems, storage facilities, and processing plants, which can improve the quality and value of their products.
Drought and other natural disasters: Cooperatives can provide farmers with access to insurance and other risk management tools to help them cope with the effects of natural disasters.
Lack of knowledge and technical expertise: Cooperatives can provide farmers with training and support to help them improve their agricultural practices and adopt new technologies.

One way to approach the challenges of lack of access to funding and limited market access is by forming agriculture cooperatives. Cooperatives can help farmers pool their resources and leverage their collective bargaining power to secure loans and investments. They can also provide a collective marketing and distribution system, allowing farmers to access a wider range of customers and fetch better prices for their products.

In addition to forming cooperatives, farmers can also seek out partnerships and other collaborative arrangements with organizations that can provide access to funding and markets. This can include working with financial institutions, government agencies, and private sector companies to secure financing and expand market opportunities.

Farmers can also consider adopting new technologies and innovative business models that can help them access funding and markets. For example, using digital platforms and e-commerce can enable farmers to reach a wider audience and sell their products directly to consumers.

Finally, engaging with policymakers and advocating for policies that support the agricultural sector can also help address these challenges. This can include advocating for access to financing, market opportunities, and other resources that can help farmers overcome challenges and succeed.

Lack of access to financing: Web3 technology can enable farmers to access alternative sources of financing, such as decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms and peer-to-peer lending networks, which can provide access to capital without the need for traditional intermediaries.
Limited market access: Web3 technology can help farmers connect directly with customers and other stakeholders, enabling them to bypass traditional intermediaries and access global markets.

Poor infrastructure: Web3 technology can facilitate the creation of decentralized infrastructure, such as decentralized storage and distribution networks, which can help farmers improve the quality and value of their products.
Drought and other natural disasters: Web3 technology can help farmers access insurance and other risk management tools that are decentralized and resistant to disruption from natural disasters.

Lack of knowledge and technical expertise: Web3 technology can provide farmers with access to decentralized networks of experts and communities of practice, which can help them improve their agricultural practices and adopt new technologies.

Inefficient supply chains: Web3 technology can help farmers create decentralized supply chains that are more transparent, efficient, and resilient, enabling them to better compete with large-scale agribusinesses.
The best way to approach and solve these challenges will vary depending on the specific situation and context. However, some general strategies that can be effective include:

Develop a comprehensive strategy: It is important to carefully assess the challenges facing the agricultural sector and develop a comprehensive plan to address them. This should involve input from all relevant stakeholders, including farmers, cooperatives, government agencies, and other organizations.

Invest in infrastructure: Improving infrastructure, such as irrigation systems, storage facilities, and processing plants, can help farmers increase productivity and improve the quality and value of their products.

Provide support and training: Farmers often face challenges due to a lack of knowledge and technical expertise. Providing access to training and support can help them improve their agricultural practices and adopt new technologies.

Foster collaboration and partnerships: Working together with other farmers, cooperatives, and organizations can help farmers overcome challenges and achieve better results. This can involve forming partnerships, sharing resources, and leveraging collective bargaining power.

Use technology and innovation: Advances in technology and innovation can help farmers improve their productivity and efficiency. This can include using precision agriculture techniques, data analytics, and other tools to optimize agricultural practices.

Engage with policymakers: It is important to engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector. This can include advocating for access to financing, market opportunities, and other resources that can help farmers overcome challenges and succeed.
Why do we have to act now?

These problems affect all humans on earth because they are fundamental challenges facing the global food system. Agriculture is a vital part of the global economy, and the challenges facing the sector can have far-reaching consequences for food security, the environment, and economic development.

For example, lack of access to financing and limited market access can make it difficult for farmers to invest in their operations and improve productivity, which can lead to higher prices and lower availability of food. Poor infrastructure and inefficient supply chains can also result in food waste and environmental degradation, which can have negative impacts on the environment and human health.

It is important to take action now to address these challenges because the global population is growing, and demand for food is expected to increase in the coming decades. If we do not take steps to address these challenges now, they are likely to become more acute in the future, with potentially severe consequences for global food security and human welfare.

By creating agricultural cooperative models that use web3 technology, we can address these challenges and help create a more sustainable and resilient global food system. Web3 technology can enable farmers to access new sources of financing, connect directly with customers, improve infrastructure, manage risks, and access knowledge and expertise, which can help them overcome these challenges and create a more prosperous and sustainable agricultural sector.
Here are some action points that can be implemented based on the need to address the challenges facing the global food system:

Encourage the adoption of web3 technology in the agricultural sector: Web3 technology offers many potential benefits for the agricultural sector, including access to alternative sources of financing, improved market access, decentralized infrastructure, and access to knowledge and expertise. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can support the adoption of web3 technology in the agricultural sector by providing education, training, and other resources to help farmers and cooperatives use these technologies effectively.

Invest in infrastructure and support services: Improving infrastructure and support services can help farmers increase productivity and improve the quality and value of their products. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can invest in infrastructure and support services, such as irrigation systems, storage facilities, and processing plants, to help farmers overcome these challenges and succeed.

Provide access to financing and market opportunities: Access to financing and market opportunities is essential for farmers to invest in their operations and improve productivity. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can support the development of alternative financing mechanisms, such as decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms, to help farmers access capital. They can also support the development of decentralized marketplaces and other platforms that can help farmers connect directly with customers and other stakeholders.

Engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector: It is important to engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector. This can include advocating for access to financing, market opportunities, and other resources that can help farmers overcome challenges and succeed. Governments, organizations, and other stakeholders can work together to engage with policymakers and advocate for policies that support the agricultural sector and help address the challenges facing the global food system.

# Constitutional Template
by Metagov

## Preamble
<!-- The preamble introduces the community / DAO, its goals, and its values. We recommend focusing on just the 2-3 values and 2-3 goals that really matter. -->

## Article 1: <Title>
<!-- Each article of the constitution should respond to the values and goals articulated in the preamble. Each article should address an important issue, policy, institution, or right. Ask yourself: if you had only five articles, would I specify this right or this policy?

National constitutions typically dont articulate policy within a constitution; rather, they describe the institutions that shape policies. Many DAOs, like other online communities, do not need  There are good reasons for taking this approach, but many online communities do not need.

Constitutions anchor a DAOs off-chain governance.

E.g. all decisions will be made by GitcoinDAO via this contract. -->

children.title: Kokonut Funnel

content.text: Awareness: The first step in the marketing funnel is to raise awareness about the agriculture project and its goals. This can be done through various marketing channels, such as social media, email marketing, and content marketing. The goal of this step is to get people interested in the project and to build a following.

Interest: The second step in the marketing funnel is to generate interest in the project and its benefits. This can be done through engaging content, such as blog posts, videos, and infographics, that showcase the project and its impact. The goal of this step is to get people excited about the project and to encourage them to learn more.

Decision: The third step in the marketing funnel is to help people make a decision about whether to support the project. This can be done through clear and concise messaging that explains the benefits of supporting the project, as well as through persuasive calls to action that encourage people to take action. The goal of this step is to get people to commit to supporting the project.

Action: The fourth step in the marketing funnel is to get people to take action and support the project. This can be done through various channels, such as a donation page, a sign-up form, or a purchase page. The goal of this step is to get people to take the desired action and support the project.

Retention: The final step in the marketing funnel is to retain the support of people who have already taken action and supported the project. This can be done through regular communication and updates about the progress of the project, as well as through thank you messages and other forms of appreciation. The goal of this step is to keep people engaged and interested in the project and to encourage them to continue supporting it.

children.title: Explainer Video Script

content.text: One Liner > Kokonut Network is a Project to Promote, Fund, & Manage Coconut Farms

Why Coconuts? > It is the most cultivated and vital palm tree in the world, as it is currently the main source of vegetable fat, Coconut is one of the plants that provide the greatest diversity of products and by-products in the world, being a primary source of food, drinks, and refuge for animals
In 2020, the global Coconut market size was
and it is expected to reach

Why a DAO and not a Company with Investors? > Answer is simple [Governance, Transparency, Accounting & Growth] while we build a worldwide community that share our vision and support us shape the future of agriculture + web3
: KokonutDAO shareholders will vote to determine the schedule of rewards for distribution in the future as new product launches, Charity Events & Agriculture Start-Ups Incubator Projects.
: Shareholders would be able to propose business ideas, proposals, new products and discuss ideas on how to enhance DAO funds far beyond the 40% base rewards from KOKONUT V1 profits.

With high demand from the national and international markets, Annual domestic production does not meet the demand. Every year Dominican Republic alone imports about 25 million units of coconut, which return to international markets as exports of coconut derivatives by-products.

We Incorporate six hundred and twenty (620) Acres of land in optimal conditions, into the national production system; to be able to increase national annual production by 18,000,000 coconuts, and decrease the shortage in the market. While we benefit and reward the whole KokonutDAO community and we create more than 10,000 direct and indirect jobs?
"Kokonut V1" is our first coconut plantation located in Los Saladillos, Dominican Republic [map widget]

Kokonut V1 consists of 60,000 coconut plants that would produce roughly 18 million coconuts per year for wholesaling to international markets and to Industrialize its direct products, such as Copra and Water as a fresh drink, as well as its other derivatives to add value to production.

They will be planted at a sowing frame of 7.5 x 7.5 meters away from each plant. That is equivalent to ninety-six (96) plants per acre of land, which equals 60,000 plants within the six hundred and twenty (620) Acres of land in hand. This variety is capable of producing about three hundred (300) fruits per plant, which makes about 18,000,000 units each year. The market price is around USD 0.44 per unit, which would be equal to USD 7,920,000.00 per year alongside more than 10,663 direct and indirect jobs.
The total cost of financing this project amounts to
will be for the preparation of the land. Also,
will be for agricultural work, and another
will be used for the purchase of: inputs, materials and equipment. In addition, about
are for the paymentof agricultural insurance.

Forecast Expenses are just approximated. We will work every month on achieving milestones, based on the master business plan for each quarter. We will vote every 4 months to approve the quarter's budget, then we will do 1 monthly vote to approve the subsequent month's plan. The vote will take place on the 21st of each month.

for a healthy project, 1 KokonutDAO Share per plant will be issued Only 60,000 "kokonut dao shares" will issued for Kokonut V1. Each one for an contribution of USD$20.00. This way we achieve the initial funding amount needed, to develop the project for 4 years until the farm is ready for the first round of harvesting. More shares will be issued for our next phase Kokonut V2 300,000 Plants 2026~.

For the purpouse of Transparency, we will use blockchain technology for each coconut plant ownership and open source accounting and enterprise system so we can offer real-time access for every member of the KokonutDAO.
: $1,200,000 [4 years budget, ~16 years harvesting until re-planting]

Our V1 Plantation consists of 60,000 coconut plants that will produce roughly 18,000,000 coconuts per year, average local wholesale price is $0.44 this equals $7,920,000 per year [we're already working on securing international buyers so we can export our product and get even more revenue.

Coconuts is one of the most useful fruits on the planet, you can make coconut milk, coconut oil, coconut body cream, coconut water, and so on, the list is almost endless, that is why this is one of the most profitable fruits in the agriculture sector.

Besides just producing and selling the coconut, we're also planning to create a range of products like coconut milk, coconut water, coconut pulp, and beauty products for retail and wholesale to international conglomerates.
all of the project sales, expenses, payroll, accounting and reports will be managed by an open source ERP System, API & username;passwords credentials will be available for KokonutDAO members.

children.contentText: IntroKokonut Network {Agriculture For Communities}One Liner > Kokonut Network is a Project to Promote, Fund, & Manage Coconut Farms Connecting Web3, Social + AgricultureWhy Coconuts? > It is the most cultivated and vital palm tree in the world, as it is currently the main source of vegetable fat, Coconut is one of the plants that provide the greatest diversity of products and by-products in the world, being a primary source of food, drinks, and refuge for animalsIn 2020, the global Coconut market size was US$12,600 million and it is expected to reach US$20,630 million by the end of 2027.Why a DAO and not a Company with Investors? > Answer is simple [Governance, Transparency, Accounting & Growth] while we build a worldwide community that share our vision and support us shape the future of agriculture + web3Governance: KokonutDAO shareholders will vote to determine the schedule of rewards for distribution in the future as new product launches, Charity Events & Agriculture Start-Ups Incubator Projects.KokonutDAO: Shareholders would be able to propose business ideas, proposals, new products and discuss ideas on how to enhance DAO funds far beyond the 40% base rewards from KOKONUT V1 profits.ProblemWith high demand from the national and international markets, Annual domestic production does not meet the demand. Every year Dominican Republic alone imports about 25 million units of coconut, which return to international markets as exports of coconut derivatives by-products.wouldnt it be nice ifWe Incorporate six hundred and twenty (620) Acres of land in optimal conditions, into the national production system; to be able to increase national annual production by 18,000,000 coconuts, and decrease the shortage in the market. While we benefit and reward the whole KokonutDAO community and we create more than 10,000 direct and indirect jobs?We Got a Plan!SOLUTION > Kokonut Network"Kokonut V1" is our first coconut plantation located in Los Saladillos, Dominican Republic [map widget]Kokonut V1 consists of 60,000 coconut plants that would produce roughly 18 million coconuts per year for wholesaling to international markets and to Industrialize its direct products, such as Copra and Water as a fresh drink, as well as its other derivatives to add value to production.Numbers, Graph & Data WidgetsThey will be planted at a sowing frame of 7.5 x 7.5 meters away from each plant. That is equivalent to ninety-six (96) plants per acre of land, which equals 60,000 plants within the six hundred and twenty (620) Acres of land in hand. This variety is capable of producing about three hundred (300) fruits per plant, which makes about 18,000,000 units each year. The market price is around USD 0.44 per unit, which would be equal to USD 7,920,000.00 per year alongside more than 10,663 direct and indirect jobs.The total cost of financing this project amounts to USD 1,055,270.08 (U.S DOLLARS). Of which USD 137,500.00 will be for the preparation of the land. Also, USD 475,000.00 will be for agricultural work, and another USD 421,325.95 will be used for the purchase of: inputs, materials and equipment. In addition, about USD 21,444.13 are for the paymentof agricultural insurance.Forecast Expenses are just approximated. We will work every month on achieving milestones, based on the master business plan for each quarter. We will vote every 4 months to approve the quarter's budget, then we will do 1 monthly vote to approve the subsequent month's plan. The vote will take place on the 21st of each month.DAO Economics for a healthy project, 1 KokonutDAO Share per plant will be issued Only 60,000 "kokonut dao shares" will issued for Kokonut V1. Each one for an contribution of USD$20.00. This way we achieve the initial funding amount needed, to develop the project for 4 years until the farm is ready for the first round of harvesting. More shares will be issued for our next phase Kokonut V2 300,000 Plants 2026~.For the purpouse of Transparency, we will use blockchain technology for each coconut plant ownership and open source accounting and enterprise system so we can offer real-time access for every member of the KokonutDAO.DAO Contract: 0xFfe8A8ec2477390c6b97074f44326fac24D7f6DDProtocol: DAOHaus FrameworkNetwork Chain: xDai/Gnosis ChainProject Category: Agriculture & DAO'sProject Longevity: Everlasting with Boundless Reach & ScalingPhase 1 Amount to Raise: $1,200,000 [4 years budget, ~16 years harvesting until re-planting]Revenue StreamsCoconut Net Sales  Our V1 Plantation consists of 60,000 coconut plants that will produce roughly 18,000,000 coconuts per year, average local wholesale price is $0.44 this equals $7,920,000 per year [we're already working on securing international buyers so we can export our product and get even more revenue.Coconut Derivatives  Coconuts is one of the most useful fruits on the planet, you can make coconut milk, coconut oil, coconut body cream, coconut water, and so on, the list is almost endless, that is why this is one of the most profitable fruits in the agriculture sector.Industrialized Coconut Products  Besides just producing and selling the coconut, we're also planning to create a range of products like coconut milk, coconut water, coconut pulp, and beauty products for retail and wholesale to international conglomerates.DAO Organigrama & Projections Visualsall of the project sales, expenses, payroll, accounting and reports will be managed by an open source ERP System, API & username;passwords credentials will be available for KokonutDAO members.Final SceneProject Highlights: Kokonut Network isCoconut Farm DevelopmentWeb3 + Agriculture60,000 Coconut Plants620 Acres of LandGovernment Agricultural PermitsDAOHaus FrameworkxDai/Gnosis ChainAgriculture DAOLifetime Project LongevityPhase 2 In The WorksBlockchain Verified AssetKokonutDAOGenuine Business ModelEco-FriendlyOpen Source AccountingWeb & Mobile AppDecentralized By DesignFunds Secured By KokonutDAO MembersProfesional Team With 35+ Years In ExperienceKOKONUT content.text: 2 00:00:03,368 --> 00:00:11,114 The following list explains in detail the meaning of being a member of Kokonut DAO.
3 00:00:11,114 --> 00:00:16,316 What to expect from being a shareholder?
4 00:00:16,316 --> 00:00:30,086 Exclusive access to members-only events, meet-ups, and governance tools available for Kokonut DAO members.
5 00:00:30,086 --> 00:00:37,341 These are 8 benefits of Kokonut Network DAO membership.

7 00:00:42,758 --> 00:00:58,105 Coconut plants usually last 16 years bearing fruits, replanting them once they no longer produce, the plantation will live forever. Our members will be enjoying a lifetime of rewards, membership status, and exclusive access to our whole network.
9 00:01:02,418 --> 00:01:10,872 We have developed a business plan, reward mechanisms, growth plan, and revenue-generating streams backed by our coconut plantation.
12 00:01:20,172 --> 00:01:29,232 Kokonut DAO transactions, treasury, and proposals are public. Anyone can and should audit this information in the blockchain explorer.

14 00:01:34,458 --> 00:01:47,593 Kokonut DAO data is stored in the Gnosis Chain forever, immutable to changes. Anyone with a phone or pc can join the DAO, permissionless and borderless because the DAO lives in the blockchain for worldwide access.
15 00:01:47,593 --> 00:01:53,971 3. Funds Secured By Kokonut DAO Members.
16 00:01:53,971 --> 00:01:59,989 2. Voting Rights On Key Business Decisions.

17 00:01:59,989 --> 00:02:11,506 Members can vote on critical or severe decisions that may affect or benefit the organization as a whole, like product launches, Charity, and Kokonut Network Expansion.
1.Plantation Earnings For Life. One Kokonut DAO share = One coconut plant lifetime ownership
19 00:02:19,474 --> 00:02:33,412 Kokonut DAO members will receive lifetime profits the plantation generates from sales, deals & branded products.
20 00:02:33,412 --> 00:02:38,854 Kokonut DAO doesnt consume your time
21 00:02:38,854 --> 00:02:53,656 There are a lot of DAOs out there that are just good ideas, great design & marketing. Without a real business plan backing them up.
22 00:02:53,656 --> 00:03:05,530 Tons of projects get rug-pulled or end up abandoned by their users because teams can't deliver a good product.
23 00:03:05,530 --> 00:03:14,236 Be smart, do your research, and choose the right path to freedom.
24 00:03:14,236 --> 00:03:20,944 Learn more at kokonut.network Follow us on Twitter @KokonutNetwork
